title: Repo reset & VidUnpack scaffold
description: Replace repo with VidUnpack (React + LangGraphJS + Rust tool server) scaffold and a single dev entrypoint.
acceptance_criteria: Old skeleton removed; `npm run dev` starts local web on port 6785; repo has plan + issues snapshot committed.
review_initial_requirements: Keep structure minimal; document run commands; ensure port/config from .env; avoid unnecessary deps.
review_regression_requirements: Fresh clone runs; smoke-flow works end-to-end; no leftover legacy files or broken scripts.
notes: picked_reason:bootstrap scaffold for all other issues | picked_at:2026-01-22 | done_at:2026-01-22 | evidence:npm web build ok; npm orchestrator build ok; cargo build ok

title: Rust tool server baseline
description: Create axum tool server with config, logging, and ffmpeg preflight checks.
acceptance_criteria: `GET /health` returns ok; config loads data root/port; missing ffmpeg gives clear error; logs are structured.
review_initial_requirements: Validate error model; path safety; avoid shell injection; document ffmpeg requirement.
review_regression_requirements: Run with/without ffmpeg; ensure stable behavior; verify API compatibility across OS.
notes: picked_reason:toolserver baseline unblocks most backend work | picked_at:2026-01-22 | done_at:2026-01-22 | evidence:cargo build -p vidunpack-toolserver ok

title: SQLite schema + project workspace
description: Implement SQLite schema and per-project folder layout under `data/`, with project CRUD and event log.
acceptance_criteria: Create/list/open project works; project folder created; sqlite indexes runs/artifacts/consent/profile; migrations idempotent.
review_initial_requirements: Schema covers needed queries; migrations safe; file paths deterministic; basic indexing for history views.
review_regression_requirements: Regression: open existing projects; migrate old schema; verify no data loss and queries remain fast.

title: Project UI + import + consent
description: Build UI to create/open project, import local video, paste link, and perform one-time project-scoped consent with optional auto-confirm.
acceptance_criteria: UI can import local video; link paste triggers disclaimer + confirm once per project; auto-confirm toggle persists; no download without consent.
review_initial_requirements: Confirm UX is clear and minimal; consent is recorded; actions are auditable; avoid accidental downloads.
review_regression_requirements: Start new project confirms again; verify toggles; verify consent does not leak across projects.

title: ffmpeg media pipeline
description: Use ffmpeg to probe metadata, extract 3 clips (start/mid/end), extract audio, and generate thumbnails/frames with caching.
acceptance_criteria: Given a video, produces metadata.json; 3 clips exist; audio extracted; thumbnails generated; cached under project; errors are actionable.
review_initial_requirements: Ensure commands are safe; cache keys stable; handle long videos; resource cleanup; cap temp usage.
review_regression_requirements: Run on different codecs/containers; ensure repeatable outputs; verify cache hit behavior and cleanup.

title: Gemini video understanding integration
description: Call Gemini API via BASE_URL using initial 3 clips; allow model selection in UI (default gemini-3-pro-preview); persist structured analysis.
acceptance_criteria: With keys configured, analysis run completes; model can request extra clips; UI shows result; failures show clear remediation; responses stored.
review_initial_requirements: Prompt keeps scope on asset aggregation for meme story videos; avoid over-constraining; log requests without leaking keys.
review_regression_requirements: Test different models/base_url; retry logic; verify no key leaks in logs or report.

title: Exa search + web_fetch loop
description: Implement Exa-backed web_search (5 results/round) + web_fetch with max 3 iterations; store citations for reporting.
acceptance_criteria: Each round returns <=5 results; total rounds <=3; fetch reads a limited set of URLs; queries/results/citations are stored and visible.
review_initial_requirements: Budget enforcement; URL fetch timeouts; content size caps; sanitize output; store provenance.
review_regression_requirements: Regression: run repeated searches; ensure deterministic storage; validate citations in report; handle provider errors gracefully.

title: Think MCP panel + toggle
description: Add a visible think() step that plans next actions (search/fetch/confirm/tool calls) and can be toggled off by user.
acceptance_criteria: When enabled, UI shows plan per step; when disabled, flow still works; all steps recorded in project log; no infinite loops.
review_initial_requirements: Keep plan concise; do not expose sensitive info; ensure toggle affects orchestration deterministically.
review_regression_requirements: Verify toggle on/off mid-project; ensure logs/replays; confirm no behavior drift with think disabled.

title: Asset aggregation pool (meme-first)
description: Aggregate candidate assets into a selection pool with grouping, dedup, and source/license metadata; support keep searching for X iteration.
acceptance_criteria: Selection pool renders; dedup collapses near-duplicates; each asset has provenance; user can request more assets and pool grows.
review_initial_requirements: Dedup strategy documented; provenance required; avoid broken links; handle missing/failed downloads cleanly.
review_regression_requirements: Regression on repeated runs; verify pool persistence; verify provenance retained after export/import manifest.

title: Static report.html + manifest.json
description: Generate a static report.html for humans and manifest.json for reproducibility, including citations and asset metadata.
acceptance_criteria: Report opens standalone; includes sources; manifest can restore project state; no server required for viewing report.
review_initial_requirements: Report must be readable; keep it static; avoid inline secrets; validate manifest schema/versioning.
review_regression_requirements: Open report on another machine; import manifest and reproduce selection pool with no missing fields.

title: Selection + zip export with size estimate
description: Provide selection UI (default select-all) and export zip containing only selected items, plus report/manifest, and original video by default; show size estimate.
acceptance_criteria: Size estimate shown before export; zip contains only checked items + report/manifest + original video; download succeeds; cancel works.
review_initial_requirements: Export must not block UI; handle large files; progress shown; partial failures reported with retry guidance.
review_regression_requirements: Export multiple projects; validate zip integrity; verify selection consistency; verify very large video case handled.

title: Gemini-skill UI/animation pass
description: Use gemini-skill workflow to let Gemini propose UI/style/animations with minimal constraints; integrate and stabilize.
acceptance_criteria: Gemini output is file-level; Codex integration passes `pnpm build`; UX is smooth; supports reduced motion; no functional regressions.
review_initial_requirements: Keep brief minimal; forbid unrequested backend changes; ensure accessibility and performance; avoid dependency bloat.
review_regression_requirements: Visual regression spot-check; verify all flows still work; mobile/desktop responsiveness acceptable.

title: Cross-project profile summary update
description: After export, generate a short session summary and update a global profile (merge, not unbounded append); inject into future runs.
acceptance_criteria: Profile exists and updates after each project; summary is short; injection improves personalization; user can view file if desired.
review_initial_requirements: Ensure profile update is deterministic; avoid leaking private content; keep size bounded; define merge strategy.
review_regression_requirements: Regression: run many projects; profile stays bounded; prompt injection does not break workflows; can be reset.

title: GitHub Actions build & packaging artifacts
description: Set up CI to build/test and package downloadable artifacts for Windows/macOS users (run instructions included).
acceptance_criteria: CI runs on PR/push; produces artifacts; caches dependencies; artifacts include clear run instructions; failures are actionable.
review_initial_requirements: Keep CI fast; avoid secrets in logs; artifact naming stable; document prerequisites (ffmpeg).
review_regression_requirements: Regression: download artifacts and run smoke test on both OS; verify versioning and reproducibility.
